title: Neurologopedics
banerDescription: Gain qualifications in diagnosing and treating speech and communication disorders caused by nervous system damage.
description:
• Speech therapists looking to expand their skills in specialized neurological speech therapy
  • Special educators and occupational therapists working with individuals after strokes, brain injuries, and neurodegenerative diseases
  • Physiotherapists and child psychologists dealing with patients with speech and communication disorders
description2: The aim of the program is to train specialists to work with individuals who, due to nervous system damage or diseases, have difficulties with speech, communication, and swallowing. The curriculum combines speech therapy and neurology to provide a comprehensive approach to diagnosis and therapy.
description3: During the course, you will acquire practical skills in diagnosing and treating aphasia, dysarthria, apraxia of speech, and disorders associated with neurodegenerative diseases. You will learn effective methods to help patients regain their communication abilities.

topics.title: Developmental Disorders in Cognitive and Speech Functions
Anatomy and Physiology of the Nervous System
Diagnosis and Therapy of Patients with Neurological Dysfunction
Diagnosis and Therapy of Patients with Hearing Impairments
Psycho- and Neurolinguistic Aspects of Speech
Diagnosis and Therapy of Autism Spectrum Disorders
Therapeutic Techniques for Neurological Speech Disorders
Language Communication Disorders in Neurological Speech Therapy

faculty: Courses are led by experienced neurologopedists, clinical speech therapists, neuropsychologists, and occupational therapists specializing in treating individuals with neurological speech disorders.
practices:
• The practice consists of 120 hours and is conducted in the second semester.
  • Practices can be held in hospitals, rehabilitation clinics, neurological speech therapy centers, and institutions supporting individuals after neurological injuries.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes is based on class participation, completion of individual modules, practice implementation, and preparation of a final thesis.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Neurologopedists in hospitals and rehabilitation clinics
  • Specialists in neurological speech therapy centers
  • Speech therapists working with individuals after strokes and brain injuries
  • Employees of centers supporting people with neurodegenerative diseases
  • Specialists assisting individuals with aphasia and dysarthria
invite: Gain practical skills in diagnosing and treating neurological speech disorders, helping individuals with communication difficulties due to nervous system damage.
